item.title: Sometimes Portfolio Projects Get Out of Hand
item.description: It Started Innocently Enough Transparently, it started as a portfolio project. I wanted to build a portfolio project so that I’d be ready if my employment situation changed. I wanted to consolidate what I’ve learned in the last few years, push my skills into new areas, and dig into gaps. I wanted to grow into a machine learning engineer and be a strong Ph.D. applicant when I finish my master’s.
